verses.verse: For Jehovah <WH3068> will have compassion <WH7355> on Jacob <WH3290>, and will yet choose <WH977> Israel <WH3478>, and set <WH3240> them in their own land <WH127>: and the sojourner <WH1616> shall join <WH3867> himself with them <WH5596>, and they shall cleave to the house <WH1004> of Jacob <WH3290>.

And the peoples <WH5971> shall take <WH3947> them <WH935>, and bring them to their place <WH4725>; and the house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478> shall possess <WH5157> them in the land <WH127> of Jehovah <WH3068> for servants <WH5650> and for handmaids <WH8198>: and they shall take them captive <WH7617> whose captives <WH7617> they were <WH7287>; and they shall rule over their oppressors <WH5065>.

And it shall come to pass in the day <WH3117> that Jehovah <WH3068> shall give thee rest <WH5117> from thy sorrow <WH6090>, and from thy trouble <WH6090>, and from the hard <WH7186> service <WH5656> wherein thou wast made to serve <WH5647>,

that thou shalt take up <WH5375> this parable <WH4912> against the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>, and say <WH559>, How hath the oppressor <WH5065> ceased <WH7673>! the golden city <WH4062> ceased <WH7673>!
Jehovah <WH3068> hath broken <WH7665> the staff <WH4294> of the wicked <WH7563>, the sceptre <WH7626> of the rulers <WH4910>;

that smote <WH5221> the peoples <WH5971> in wrath <WH5678> with a continual <WH1115> stroke <WH4347>, that ruled <WH7287> the nations <WH1471> in anger <WH639>, with a persecution <WH4783> that none <WH1097> restrained <WH2820>.
The whole earth <WH776> is at rest <WH5117>, and is quiet <WH8252>: they break forth <WH6476> into singing <WH7440>.
Yea <WH1265>, the fir-trees rejoice <WH8055> at thee <WH730>, and the cedars of Lebanon <WH3844>, saying <WH7901>, Since thou art laid low, no hewer <WH3772> is come up against us <WH5927>.

Sheol <WH7585> from beneath is moved <WH7264> for thee to meet <WH7125> thee at thy coming <WH935>; it stirreth up <WH5782> the dead <WH7496> for thee <WH6260>, even all the chief ones of the earth <WH776>; it hath raised up <WH6965> from their thrones <WH3678> all the kings <WH4428> of the nations <WH1471>.
All they shall answer <WH6030> and say <WH559> unto thee <WH2470>, Art thou also become weak as we <WH4911>? art thou become like unto us?
Thy pomp <WH1347> is brought down <WH3381> to Sheol <WH7585>, and the noise <WH1998> of thy viols <WH5035>: the worm <WH7415> is spread <WH3331> under thee <WH8438>, and worms cover thee <WH4374>.

How art thou fallen <WH5307> from heaven <WH8064>, O day-star <WH1966>, son <WH1121> of the morning <WH7837>! how art thou cut down <WH1438> to the ground <WH776>, that didst lay low <WH2522> the nations <WH1471>!

And thou saidst <WH559> in thy heart <WH3824>, I will ascend <WH5927> into heaven <WH8064>, I will exalt <WH7311> my throne <WH3678> above <WH4605> the stars <WH3556> of God <WH410>; and I will sit <WH3427> upon the mount <WH2022> of congregation <WH4150>, in the uttermost parts <WH3411> of the north <WH6828>;
I will ascend <WH5927> above the heights <WH1116> of the clouds <WH5645>; I will make myself like <WH1819> the Most High <WH5945>.
Yet thou shalt be brought down <WH3381> to Sheol <WH7585>, to the uttermost parts <WH3411> of the pit <WH953>.

They that see <WH7200> thee shall gaze <WH7688> at thee <WH995>, they shall consider thee <WH376>, saying, Is this the man that made the earth <WH776> to tremble <WH7264>, that did shake <WH7493> kingdoms <WH4467>;
that made <WH7760> the world <WH8398> as a wilderness <WH4057>, and overthrew <WH2040> the cities <WH5892> thereof <WH6605>; that let not loose his prisoners <WH615> to their home <WH1004>?
All the kings <WH4428> of the nations <WH1471>, all of them <WH7901>, sleep in glory <WH3519>, every one <WH376> in his own house <WH1004>.

But thou art cast forth <WH7993> away from thy sepulchre <WH6913> like an abominable <WH8581> branch <WH5342>, clothed <WH3830> with the slain <WH2026>, that are thrust through <WH2944> with the sword <WH2719>, that go down <WH3381> to the stones <WH68> of the pit <WH953>; as a dead body <WH6297> trodden under foot <WH947>.

Thou shalt not be joined <WH3161> with them in burial <WH6900>, because thou hast destroyed <WH7843> thy land <WH776>, thou hast slain <WH2026> thy people <WH5971>; the seed <WH2233> of evil-doers <WH7489> shall not be named <WH7121> for ever <WH5769>.

Prepare <WH3559> ye slaughter <WH4293> for his children <WH1121> for the iniquity <WH5771> of their fathers <WH1>, that they rise <WH6965> not <WH1077> up <WH3423>, and possess the earth <WH776>, and fill <WH4390> the face <WH6440> of the world <WH8398> with cities <WH6145>.

And I will rise up <WH6965> against them <WH5002>, saith Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, and cut off <WH3772> from Babylon <WH894> name <WH8034> and remnant <WH7605>, and son <WH5209> and son <WH5220>'s son, saith <WH5002> Jehovah <WH3068>.

I will also make <WH7760> it a possession <WH4180> for the porcupine <WH7090>, and pools <WH98> of water <WH4325>: and I will sweep <WH2894> it with the besom <WH4292> of destruction <WH8045>, saith <WH5002> Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>.
Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> hath sworn <WH7650>, saying <WH559>, Surely <WH1819>, as I have thought, so shall it come to pass <WH3289>; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand <WH6965>:

that I will break <WH7665> the Assyrian <WH804> in my land <WH776>, and upon my mountains <WH2022> tread him under foot <WH947>: then shall his yoke <WH5923> depart <WH5493> from off them <WH5448>, and his burden depart <WH5493> from off their shoulder <WH7926>.
This is the purpose <WH6098> that is purposed <WH3289> upon the whole earth <WH776>; and this is the hand <WH3027> that is stretched out <WH5186> upon all the nations <WH1471>.
For Jehovah <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> hath purposed <WH3289>, and who shall annul <WH6565> it <WH3027>? and his hand is stretched out <WH5186>, and who shall turn it back <WH7725>?
In the year <WH8141> that king <WH4428> Ahaz <WH271> died <WH4194> was this burden <WH4853>.

Rejoice <WH8055> not <WH6429>, O Philistia, all of thee <WH7626>, because the rod that smote <WH5221> thee is broken <WH7665>; for out of the serpent <WH5175>'s root <WH8328> shall come forth <WH3318> an adder <WH6848>, and his fruit <WH6529> shall be a fiery <WH8314> flying <WH5774> serpent <WH8314>.

And the first-born <WH1060> of the poor <WH1800> shall feed <WH7462>, and the needy <WH34> shall lie down <WH7257> in safety <WH983>; and I will kill <WH4191> thy root <WH8328> with famine <WH7458>, and thy remnant <WH7611> shall be slain <WH2026>.

Howl <WH3213>, O gate <WH8179>; cry <WH2199>, O city <WH5892>; thou art melted <WH4127> away <WH6429>, O Philistia, all of thee <WH935>; for there cometh a smoke <WH6227> out of the north <WH6828>, and there is no straggler <WH909> in his ranks <WH4151>.

What then shall one answer <WH6030> the messengers <WH4397> of the nation <WH1471>? That Jehovah <WH3068> hath founded <WH3245> Zion <WH6726>, and in her shall the afflicted <WH6041> of his people <WH5971> take refuge <WH2620>.
